bibl.title: Letter from L.O. Howard to Jefferson Randolph Kean, March 18, 1925

div1.p: Howard informs Kean that his review of the Gorgas biography was reprinted, but not in "Science."

div1.head: Letter from L.O. Howard to Jefferson Randolph Kean, March 18, 1925
div1.opener:
UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE
BUREAU OF ENTOMOLOGY
WASHINGTON, D. C.
March 18, 1925.
Colonel J. R. Kean, U.S. Army (Retired),
Army Medical Museum.
Dear Colonel Kean:
div1.p:
I have just received yours of the 17th with the two separates of
the editorial about which we have been corresponding. I am greatly in-
debted to you.

Apropos to the “wider circulation” for this editorial, suggested
by your letter of March 14th, I am sure that you have seen a reprint in
one of the other medical journals which was shown to me last night at the
Cosmos Club by a medical man whose face seemed familiar to me but whom
I could not call by name. It seemed to be a reprint in full, and I am
very glad to see that it has been taken up by other journals and evidently
will be given wide publicity.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, L. O. Howard
Chief of Bureau. loh-wft
